title: Research-based Earth Science (MPG) project learning for K-12: Strengthening scientific inquiry report writing and presentation skills

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational geology and chemistry concepts, awareness of basic scientific inquiry report structure (introduction-methods-results-analysis-conclusion), and basic proficiency with digital tools (documents·presentations)
context.additional_context: Conducting field research and data analysis projects using digital devices. Learners refine skills in writing integrated text-visual reports, presentation expression techniques, and improve communication abilities through peer evaluation feedback.

learning_goals: Apply core concepts of mineralogy, petrology, and geochemistry (MPG) to project contexts and explain them in a scientific inquiry report (introduction-methods-results-analysis-conclusion).
Secure the ability to analyze and interpret real geological samples through team-based investigative activities and express findings in structured text (including graphs/tables).

Learners organize science experiment results in a 5-stage structure (introduction-methods-results-analysis-conclusion) using digital tools (Google Docs, Canva, etc.), create a 3-minute presentation, and achieve a 'B' (80–89 points) or higher in 4 out of 5 peer evaluation rubric items (clarity, logic, creativity, visuals, time management).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
